unnormalised: New Delhi: Students across India are reportedly finding new ways to tackle complex math problems thanks to LaTeX, a powerful typesetting system. From IIT hopefuls to CBSE board exam preppers, the use of LaTeX is on the rise. According to sources, the visually appealing and structurally sound representation of equations is a major draw. Think of it as crafting perfect equations that are easy to read and understand, just like a printed textbook!
normalised: New Delhi: Students across India are reportedly finding new ways to tackle complex math problems thanks to L-A-T-e-X, a powerful typesetting system. From I-I-T hopefuls to C-B-S-E board exam preppers, the use of L-A-T-e-X is on the rise. According to sources, the visually appealing and structurally sound representation of equations is a major draw. Think of it as crafting perfect equations that are easy to read and understand, just like a printed textbook!

unnormalised: One student, Rohan Sharma from Delhi, shared his experience: "Earlier, writing complex formulas like the quadratic equation $\frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$ in a simple text editor was a nightmare. Now, with LaTeX, it’s a breeze! It not only looks professional but also helps me understand the underlying concepts better." He also mentioned that his friends are using Overleaf, an online LaTeX editor, for collaborative assignments.

unnormalised: This trend isn't limited to just high school students. College students pursuing degrees in engineering and sciences are also actively utilizing LaTeX for writing research papers and project reports. For example, demonstrating the binomial theorem: $(x + y)^n = \sum_{k=0}^{n} {n \choose k} x^{n-k} y^k$, is much clearer and more concise when formatted using LaTeX, avoiding ambiguity and potential for errors.

unnormalised: Educators are also recognizing the benefits of this technology. "We encourage our students to learn LaTeX," says Dr. Meena Patel, a mathematics professor at Mumbai University. "It not only enhances the quality of their assignments but also prepares them for advanced research work where LaTeX is the industry standard." She added that understanding basic commands like "\frac", "\sqrt", and "\sum" is essential for any serious math student.
